messages.message:
Hi Ben, in flow dashboard, a non site admin user can only see the jobs that are run by them. A site admin can see all the jobs in the environment. So my first step would be to check the user’s permission and see if they are a site admin. That may explain the difference in number.

The second thing is flow dashboard only supports flow V2 and V3. Flow V1 jobs are not there. V1 flows are non-compiled flows - so for example, if you run a ibflow from the UI and de-select “compile and run as a binary”.

Many common features like pre and post-flow UDF, logging, using Marketplace packages, are not supported in Flow V1. So it is rarely used now, but it might still be worth checking to see if JPMC ran some flows in this legacy mode.

Otherwise, flow dashboard should be the source of truth for flow jobs (runs).

Hey Kerry (merry Christmas) 

The user is a site admin and all apps are compiled as binaries or marketplace apps, so am I correct in thinking that all runs should be visible?
